protocol_affiliation: University of Tsukuba,University of British Columbia

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6vduu","text":"Transfer Oxyrrhis marina (NIES-494) cells to 20 mL of fresh IMK medium (Nihon Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd.) in a plastic flask (IWAKI 75 cm2) at the concentration of 200 cells\/mL, and add Pyramimonas parkeae (NIES-254) as feed at the concentration of 1\u00d7104 cells\/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":9,"length":15,"style":"italic"},{"offset":184,"length":19,"style":"italic"},{"offset":135,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":251,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ssm7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6n7g4","text":"Grow cells at 22\u2103 with a light\/dark cycle of 14h\/8h for 14 days. After two weeks, the cell density of O. marina will reach approximately 1\u00d7104cells\/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":102,"length":9,"style":"italic"},{"offset":141,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"33E5EE00E19A11E88A77A75C7E9E162A","id":679823,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Culture condition of O. marina"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hmkf","text":"Collect O. marina and P. parkeaecells from 20 mL culture by centrifugation at 1,500 g for 4 min with a swing rotor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":8,"length":9,"style":"italic"},{"offset":22,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"appuq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"be4k3","text":"Resuspend cells with 2 mL fresh IMK medium, and then transfer to a 12-well plastic plate. Incubate the plate in a dark condition at 22\u2103.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4t9eh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqg5d","text":"After 4 days, the cell density of O. marina will be increased from 1\u00d7105cells\/mL (0 day) to 5\u00d7105 cells\/mL (4 days), in contrast with the drastic decrease of P. parkeae cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":34,"length":9,"style":"italic"},{"offset":158,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":71,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":96,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"489EA5D0E19A11E88A77A75C7E9E162A","id":679824,"previous_id":679823,"previous_guid":"33E5EE00E19A11E88A77A75C7E9E162A","section":"Concentration of O. marina cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u4j1","text":"Harvest O. marina cells at 1,500 g for 4 min with a swing rotor, and then resuspend the cell pellet by 100 \u00b5L Gene Pulser electroporation buffer (Bio-Rad #1652676) at the final concentration of 1\u00d7106 to 5\u00d7106cells\/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":8,"length":9,"style":"italic"},{"offset":198,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":207,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"603ig","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qetq","text":"Add DNA (5-25 \u00b5g) or RNA (5 \u00b5g) to the cell solution, and transfer it to a 0.2 cm cuvette (Bio-Rad). Immediately after electrophoresis, add 1.9 mL fresh IMK medium into the cuvette, and transfer the cells to a 12-well plastic plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6AC097E0E19A11E88A77A75C7E9E162A","id":679825,"previous_id":679824,"previous_guid":"489EA5D0E19A11E88A77A75C7E9E162A","section":"Electroporation with Bio-Rad Gene Pulser Xcell"}
steps.section: Electroporation with Bio-Rad Gene Pulser Xcell
